card.note: Abraham Lincoln said, "Teach the children so it will not be necessary to teach the adults." /R/RThank you Ms. J /Rfor teaching us all.
card.author: Sarah Solari

card.note: Thank you for always being so nice and helpful.
card.author: Isabel Iniguez

card.note: I really like your positive attitude and your shiny sandals (LOL).
card.author: Isabel Iniguez

card.note: Thank you for making learning a fun and creative process for Elsa this year! We are so grateful for your positive and thoughtful influence.
card.author: The Williams Family

card.note: Recently Logan said to me that this school year flew by. He stated that he was never once bored in class and that there were always fun and interesting things to do. We know this is a testament to your hard work and creative teaching style. Forever grateful,
card.author: Gabriel and Suzanna Tiffany

card.note: Ms. J, we feel so lucky that Joe and Nicole both got to have you as their third grade teacher. From the time we first met you six years ago, we have always loved your positive, can-do attitude. Joe and Nicole will always remember you. Room 8 is truly great!
card.author: The Archers

card.note: Just wanted to thank you for the opportunity to help teacher your students to knit.
card.author: Joy Duncan (Isabel's Grandmother)

card.note: It is really fun to see a gifted teacher at work! Mrs. Johnson, you have been a great teacher for Zane this year, motivating him to do his best. We couldn't have asked for a better teacher for his first year at LDV. We hope to see you again in a few years with Lilly!
card.author: Shaun and Mike Gray

card.note: We appreciate you holding Drew accountable for his actions, his school work, for being consistent, kind, organized, and a great role model. You are the perfect blend of strong and caring and have been the best 3rd grade teacher!
card.author: The Garfield's

card.note: You are a good teacher because you help us and cheer us on. Also you help us knit you are a good teacher. You are fun. My favorite year was learning my times tables.
card.author: Claire Marshall

card.note: I loved painting the gourd birds with you. I like doing art with you and learning about art. I also enjoy math and I'm so happy I learned my times tables. You are the best teacher. Room 8 the Great!
card.author: Ryan Marshall

card.note: Thank you very much for all that you have done for Rosalie and the class. You have made 3rd grade a great experience. Oh, and thanks for making Zoey feel like she is part of your class too! It makes her eager for school.
card.author: Jeannine, Mickey, Rosalie and Zoey

card.note: Ms. Johnson,/RBenjamin Franklin said "Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn." Thank you for inspiring me to be ready for the big change to 4th grade. You made my year special and joyful.
card.author: Gianna Solari

card.note: Ms. Johnson: This was a great year. I loved knitting with you, having you help me with my /Rgourd bird and teaching me /Rall my times facts. /R/RI had great times with you this year - thank you for making this year special!
card.author: Gianna Solari

card.note: We had heard through the years that you were the best! You sure did not disappoint, thank you for a great year. Our kids will be well prepared for 4th grade thanks to you!
card.author: The Hammad Family

card.note: Thank you for helping me to improve in my writing, artwork and math. You have made this year the best year ever. Room #8, the great. YAY!
card.author: Jackson Hammad

card.note: Education breeds confidence. Confidence breeds hope. Hope breeds peace.
card.author: Confucius

card.note: The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires.
card.author: William A. Ward

card.note: Education is not filling of a pail but the lighting of a fire.
card.author: William Butler Yeats

card.note: The function of education is to teach one to think intensively and to think critically. Intelligence plus character – that is the goal of true education.
card.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

card.note: The secret in education lies in respecting the student.
card.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

card.note: When you learn, teach. /RWhen you get, give.
card.author: Maya Angelou

card.note: Don’t just teach your kids to read, teach them to question /Rwhat they read. /R/RTeach them to question everything!
card.author: George Carlin

card.note: Live as if you were /Rto die tomorrow. /R/RLearn as if you were /Rto live forever.
card.author: Mahatma Gandhi

card.note: The beautiful thing about /Rlearning is that/R no one can take it /Raway from you.
card.author: B.B. King

card.note: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
card.author: Nelson Mandela

card.note: Ms. Johnson you have made my work better because you constantly remind me to double check my work./RYou are always calm and patient with us and you never stress out which makes me feel great about being in your class./R/RI appreciate you being my 3rd grade teacher./R
card.author: Katie James

card.note: One thing I was particularly struck by when I picked my daughter Lucy up from school is that every day, without exception, Ms. Johnson always hugged every kid (except the ones who preferred to high five) as they left class. To me this showed how much she cared.
card.author: Lucy, Jani and Ivor

card.note: Ms. J made my first year at LDV really fun! I think she is a really good artist too. I love how many fun events and field trips we all got to go on together.
card.author: Zane Gray

card.note: The Gueffroy Family - Ms. J., thank you so much for guiding both of our children in their education journey. 3rd grade was a wonderful year for all of us, and we are sad that we don’t have any more to send your way. /RWe’ll miss Room 8!
card.author: The Gueffroy Family

card.note: You are a very nice, friendly teacher and I enjoyed being in your class. I feel like I’m ready /Rfor 4th grade after being in /Ryour classroom!
card.author: Charlotte Gueffroy

card.note: Thank you for taking us /Ron field trips. /RI will always remember the /ROld Schoolhouse!
card.author: Mela Eselekhomhen

card.note: Thank you for helping me /Rlearn and teaching me how to /Rdo different things.
card.author: Azul Padilla

card.note: Thank you for being the best /R3rd grade teacher!
card.author: Annabelle Davis

card.note: Thank you for taking us on /Rall the field trips. /R/RMy favorite was Effie Yeaw because I liked the stations.
card.author: Logan Tiffany

card.note: Thank you for teaching us. /R/RI really enjoyed knitting.
card.author: Vadim Marushka

card.note: Thank you for being my teacher and thank you for all of the great stuff you’ve done for our class.
card.author: Kennedy Rechs

card.note: Ms. Johnson,/R/RI liked doing the Young Authors and the gourd birds.
card.author: Kristina Herr

card.note: My favorite thing in 3rd grade /Rwas all the art projects /Rwe got to do!
card.author: Elsa Williams

card.note: The drumming and art projects in 3rd grade were a lot of fun. I also like the Young Authors project.
card.author: Drew Garfield

card.note: Thank you Ms. Johnson - I had fun drumming and doing /Rwatercolor art projects. /R/RI liked the Genius Hour /Rand book reviews.
card.author: Kenyon Jones

card.note: Your are a great /R3rd grade teacher!
card.author: Sage Johnson

card.note: Ms. Johnson -/RI liked doing all the art! /R/RMy favorite project was making the gourd bird.
card.author: Cole Tyzzer

card.note: Thank you Ms. Johnson!/R/RI liked all of the fun field trips we got to go on. /R/RThe Maidu Field Day was /Rmy favorite!
card.author: Zane Gray

card.note: Hi Ms. Johnson:/R/RI really liked all of /Rthe field trips we went on./R/RThank you SO MUCH!
card.author: Rosalie

card.note: Ms. Johnson, you are THE BEST 3rd grade teacher!
card.author: Grant Towne

card.note: Ms. J: Thank you for being our 3rd grade teacher. You are a wonderful teacher and I learned a lot. You really helped me.
card.author: Victoria

card.note: You are a nice teacher.
card.author: Lucy

card.note: Thank you Ms. Johnson!
card.author: Elijah and Julian
